headline: Britannia may name new CEO in 3-4 months, MD Varun Berry gets additional charge
intro: Britannia Industries plans to appoint a new CEO following Rajneet Kohli's departure. Varun Berry has been designated as interim CEO effective 8 May
imagecaption: Varun Berryhas been designated as CEO of Britannia by the board of directors, Pic by Hemant Mishra/Mint

headline: Escalating India-Pakistan tensions trigger stockpiling in border regions
intro: Union food and consumer affairs minister Pralhad Joshi urged the public to disregard what he called misleading messages about food stocks, adding that there are enough supplies available in the country.
imagecaption: Packaged food companies said demand has increased from border cities in north India. Companies assured supplies of adequate stock in such markets.

headline: L&T, Britannia to Zee Entertainment: 6 stocks declare dividends up to  ?75: Do you own?
intro: Dividend Stocks: L&T, Britannia Industries, Asian Paints, REC Ltd, Zee Entertainment and Aarti Industries have declared dividends of up to  ?75 along with their Q4 results.
imagecaption: Dividend Stocks: 5 Stocks declare dividend up to  ?75

headline: Stocks to watch: Titan, L&T, Paytm, BPCL, Suzlon among shares in focus today amid India-Pakistan tensions
intro: Stocks to watch: L&T, Titan Company, Coal India, Lupin, Suzlon Energy, are among the stocks to watch in today's trading session.
imagecaption: Stocks to watch: The Gift Nifty also indicates a gap-down opening for the Indian benchmark indices - Sensex and Nifty 50.

headline: Q4 results today: Britannia, Bharat Forge, Asian Paints and L&T among 74 companies to declare earnings on May 8
intro: Q4 results today: On May 8, additional firms, including Britannia Industries and Canara Bank, are set to announce their financial outcomes, per the BSE calendar.
imagecaption: Q4 results today: Britannia Industries will declare earnings today.

headline: Britannia, Tata Consumer to HUL: 14 Nifty FMCG stocks rally up to 30% from March lows. What's behind the surge?
intro: FMCG stocks have rallied in April, driven by positive investor sentiment and government measures boosting consumption. Analysts anticipate a strong recovery in earnings growth in FY26, with valuations now reasonable after previous selling pressure in the sector.
imagecaption: 14 Nifty FMCG stocks rally up to 30% from March lows: Tata Consumer, GCPL top gainers

headline: Stocks to Buy: Britannia, Aarti Industries are 2 technical picks by Reliance Sec for 14-26% upside over 8-10 weeks
intro: Stocks to Buy: Britannia Industries , Aarti Industries are 2 technical picks recommended by Reliance Securities for 14-26% upside with investment horizon of 8-10 week. Check details
imagecaption: Stocks to Buy: 2 technical picks by Reliance Sec

headline: Nifty 50 valuation to rise after inclusion of Zomato, Jio Financial Services shares
intro: Nifty 50 P/E ratio stands at 19.9x, based on an estimated EPS of  ?1,186 for FY26. However, post the rebalancing, the index is projected to trade at a P/E of 20.2x, with a revised EPS estimate of  ?1,171 for the same period.
imagecaption: Zomato and Jio Financial Services shares will replace BPCL and Britannia Industries shares in Nifty 50.

headline: Britannia's Rajneet Kohli joins Hindustan Unilever as executive director
intro: Kohli, former CEO of Britannia Industries, will lead Hindustan Unilever's food and refreshment division, its second-largest business unit.
imagecaption: In 2023-24, the foods and refreshment business contributed 25% of HUL?s turnover. (Reuters)

headline: Nifty 50 Rejig: Zomato, Jio Financial Services to replace BPCL, Britannia Industries in frontline index
intro: Nifty 50 Rejig: Zomato, Jio Financial Services, PowerGrid Corporation of India and CG Power and Industrial Solutions are expected to see the highest passive inflows in the Nifty indices March rebalancing.
imagecaption: Nifty 50 Rejig: Zomato shares inclusion into the frontline Nifty 50 index is expected to lead to passive inflows worth $602 million in the stock
